definition: to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
to be used up/to be exhausted

sentences.english: Lounge patrons desperately wanted to imbibe the essence of all this.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的老主顾们极欲将全部精华吸收殆尽。
难道一切都毫无疑问地丧失殆尽了吗？

sentences.english: As the protests spread, the government's patience ran out.
sentences.chinese: 随着抗议活动范围的扩大，巴政府的耐心也消耗殆尽。

sentences.english: His  spirit was vitiated by pleasure seeking.
sentences.chinese: 他的志气因追求吃喝玩乐而消磨殆尽。

sentences.english: As a result, other species are running out of places to live.
sentences.chinese: 结果是其他物种的生存空间正被人类挤占殆尽。

sentences.english: Colic is almost always gone in four months.
sentences.chinese: 疝气总是在四个月内就几乎消失殆尽。

sentences.english: Take a drag on a cigarette, and your hunger will likely disappear.
sentences.chinese: 只要吸上一口烟，你的饥饿感就会消失殆尽。
她的财产慢慢消散殆尽。

sentences.english: Even large fortunes can dissipate after a generation or two.
sentences.chinese: 再巨大的财富，一两代人后也会消散殆尽。

sentences.english: The density of carriers in the region has been depleted .
sentences.chinese: 在这个区内的载流子浓度被消耗殆尽。

sentences.english: The king is sheard of his power by his nobles.
sentences.chinese: 国王的大权被他的贵族们剥夺殆尽。

sentences.english: RANAGHAT/KOLKATA: The sense of security has all but vanished, but there is no anger in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 安全感已经消失殆尽，但是她的声音听不出任何愤怒。

sentences.english: Commercially viable phosphate deposits were exhausted at the time of independence.
sentences.chinese: 在独立期间，可用于商业的磷酸盐被消耗殆尽。

sentences.english: Colonies that were once thriving suddenly went still, almost overnight.
sentences.chinese: 一度繁盛的蜂群几乎在一夜之间突然消失殆尽。

sentences.english: Our life is frittered away by detail.
sentences.chinese: 我们的生活被细节消耗殆尽。

sentences.english: The meager profit in the factory has vanished into thin air, due to long funds tied up.
sentences.chinese: 工厂微薄的利润由于漫长的资金占压而消失殆尽。

definition: to exhaust/to use up/to deplete/to drain
to wear down/to sap/to whittle away/to while away/to idle away
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to be used up/to be exhausted
to go up in smoke/to vanish
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
